description: This table contains one row for each transaction on a claim that is or has been in the claim error pool. This table updates records for transactions on claims that are still in the claim error pool but leaves the records for transactions on claims that are no longer in the error pool. There is only one date field concerning when the record was created, EXTRACT_DATE, which functions as in CLM_EDIT_WQ_DETAIL. After the claim has left the claim error pool, the last record will remain in the table indefinitely.

columns.name: CLP_ID
columns.description: The ID of the claim record that entered the claim edit workqueue.

columns.name: LINE
columns.description: The line number of the transaction that appears on the claim record.

columns.name: PERFORMING_PROV_ID
columns.description: The ID of the provider who performed the transaction's service(s).

columns.name: REFERRAL_PROV_ID
columns.description: The ID of the transaction's referring provider.

columns.name: REFERRAL_PROV_ID_REFERRING_PROV_NAM
columns.description: The name of the referral source.

columns.name: ORIG_AMOUNT
columns.description: The original amount of the transaction.

columns.name: AMOUNT_DUE
columns.description: The amount of money due for the transaction at the time of the extract.

columns.name: DEPARTMENT_ID
columns.description: The department ID where the transaction originated.

columns.name: REV_LOC_ID
columns.description: The revenue location where the transaction originated.

columns.name: PROC_ID
columns.description: The procedure ID for the transaction.

columns.name: SERVICE_DATE
columns.description: The date for which services were performed.

columns.name: POST_DATE
columns.description: The date the transaction was posted.

columns.name: BILLING_PROV_ID
columns.description: The ID of the provider to whom services are being billed.

columns.name: POS_ID
columns.description: The place of service where the transaction originated.

columns.name: VISIT_NUMBER
columns.description: The visit number within the account that corresponds to the transaction. This number uniquely identifies the visit within the account only.
